posts.post_content: "Hey look! Regeneration is out of M10! That's right! You never really liked that card, eh? It was almost useless? Well, we heard you. Here's a completely new card that's a strictly worse Reknit which never saw any play in the first place, ENJOY!"

posts.post_content: It boggles my mind that they didn't make this 1 mana. We already were given the superior Wrap in Vigor for 2 mana in future sight, and several creatures regenerate for 1 mana naturally. As much as i like the idea behind moving Regeneartion from enchantment into instant speed, this is a surprising opportunity missed by Wizards.

posts.post_content: Good for sniping a regeneration onto a creature, but not as good as the enchantment counterpart, [Regeneration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Regeneration), that it appears to be replacing. I'd rather have an enchantment with a regeneration ability usable repeatedly that an opponent has to waste a destruction spell on rather than an instant that only works once.
posts.html:

Posted By: Oleander (7/11/2009 4:35:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Eh, I don't mind that it's 1![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), if you're running green you shouldn't be having mana issues. A typical green deck or even White/Green for that matter should have at least 7-8 mana by turn 5 or 6. The longer the battle goes on, the more mana you have. I don't play with a lot of pro-level decks, so maybe I'm missing that element, but for casual decks, 1![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) doesn't seem like too much.
posts.html:

Posted By: coyotemoon722 (10/7/2009 11:02:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why did such a useless card have to take such a generous name?  
  
For what reason does this have a mana cost of ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) and not ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)? Oldschool [Death Ward](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Ward) never was even remotely broken at the cost of ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), so why the colorless mana?  
Like this it's also worse than [Reknit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reknit) which can also be payed with white mana and can regenerate any permanent.  
[Wrap in Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrap in Vigor) is also superior to this card most of the time.  
I can't quite believe Wizards didn't consider that when designing that card, but apparently they kept their eyes straight on [Regeneration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Regeneration) only.  
  
Sigh...
